Name: Cognitive Barrier Classifier
Purpose: Infer and prioritize the most likely cognitive barriers (e.g., overload, ambiguity aversion, choice paralysis, over/underconfidence) that block investment decision-making for young professionals.
Deliverables: Structured posterior distributions over barrier types and intensities, conditioned on observable behaviors, self-reports, and context signals; ranked list of cognitive barriers with confidence scores and explanatory feature attributions.
Strengths: Effective at distinguishing between similar-looking barriers (e.g., lack of information vs. too much undirected information) and quantifying which cognitive distortions most reduce confidence; robust to noisy, partial data.
Watch-out: Fails when priors are mis-specified or key barrier types are missing from the hypothesis space; can overfit to observed signals and misinterpret structural, external constraints as cognitive barriers.
